pageContext.claim: “Prior to last year, where I attended my first meeting, it was going down -- the amount of money being spent by countries was going down and down very substantially.  And now, it’s going up very substantially.”
pageContext.analysis: Defense spending by NATO members has been increasing {since 2014}. After the annexation of Crimea, members agreed to increase their defense spending to 2 percent of GDP by 2024. In other words, spending increases started before Trump entered politics.
